entry.content:
Bug fixes:

- Fix resetting of DNS nameservers in systemd-networkd units ([PR#12](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/systemd/pull/12))

Changes:

- Disable TX checksum offloading for the IP-in-IP tunl0 interface used by Calico ([PR#26](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/init/pull/26)). This is a workaround for a Mellanox driver issue, currently tracked in [Flatcar#183](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/Flatcar/issues/183)
- Set `sysctl net.ipv4.conf.(all|*).rp_filter` to 0 (instead of the systemd upstream value 2) to be less restrictive which some network solutions rely on ([PR#11](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/systemd/pull/11))
- Update-engine now detects rollbacks and reports them as errors to the update server ([PR#6](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/update_engine/pull/6))
- `flatcar-install` allows installation to a multipath drive ([PR#24](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/init/pull/24))
- Support the `lockdown` kernel command line parameter ([PR#533](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/553))
- Update public key to include a [new subkey](https://www.flatcar-linux.org/security/image-signing-key/)

Updates:

- Linux [5.8.9](https://lwn.net/Articles/831365/)
- linux-firmware [20200817](https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/firmware/linux-firmware.git/tag/?h=20200817)
- Go [1.15.2](https://golang.org/doc/go1.15)
- Rust [1.46.0](https://blog.rust-lang.org/2020/08/27/Rust-1.46.0.html)

Note: Please note that ARM images remain experimental for now.

Packages:
- docker 19.03.12
- ignition 0.34.0
- kernel 5.8.9
- rkt 1.30.0
- systemd 245

Architectures:
- amd64
- arm64

Bug fixes:

- Resolve ipset API incompatibility [Flatcar#174](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/Flatcar/issues/174)
- Fix udev rule warning about ignored value [Flatcar#164](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/Flatcar/issues/164)
- Add missing `render` group [Flatcar#169](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/Flatcar/issues/169)

Changes:

- Mount `/sys/fs/bpf` into the toolbox container and allow BPF syscalls ([PR#544](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/544))
- Support loading BPF programs with `tc` [Flatcar#172](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/Flatcar/issues/172)

Updates:

- Linux [5.4.61](https://lwn.net/Articles/829613/)
- etcd-wrapper/etcdctl [3.3.25](https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/releases/tag/v3.3.25)
- ipset [7.6](https://lwn.net/Articles/813097/)
- iproute [5.8](https://lwn.net/Articles/828370/)
- mdadm [4.1](https://mirrors.edge.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/raid/mdadm/ANNOUNCE)
- VMware: openvm-tools [11.1.5](https://github.com/vmware/open-vm-tools/blob/stable-11.1.5/ReleaseNotes.md)

Note: Please note that ARM images remain experimental for now.

Security fixes:



* Bind: fixes for [CVE-2020-8616](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-8616), [CVE-2020-8617](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-8617), [CVE-2020-8620](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-8620), [CVE-2020-8621](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-8621), [CVE-2020-8622](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-8622), [CVE-2020-8623](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-8623), [CVE-2020-8624](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-8624)

Bug fixes:



* etcd-wrapper: Adjust data dir permissions [https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/536](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/536)

Changes:



* Add drivers for qedf, qedi, qla4xxx as kernel modules [https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/528](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/528)

Updates:



* Linux [5.4.59](https://lwn.net/Articles/829106/)
* Bind-tools [9.16.6](https://ftp.isc.org/isc/bind9/cur/9.16/RELEASE-NOTES-bind-9.16.6.html)
* Openssl [1.1.1g](https://www.openssl.org/news/openssl-1.1.1-notes.html)
* etcd-wrapper [3.3.24](https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/releases/tag/v3.3.24)
* sssd [1.16.3](https://sssd.io/docs/users/relnotes/notes_1_16_3.html)
* kerberos [1.18.2](https://web.mit.edu/kerberos/krb5-1.18/)
* Containerd [1.3.7](https://github.com/containerd/containerd/releases/tag/v1.3.7)
* Go [1.13.15](https://go.googlesource.com/go/+/refs/tags/go1.13.15) used for compilation
Packages:
- docker 19.03.12
- ignition 0.34.0
- kernel 5.4.59
- rkt 1.30.0

Bug Fixes:
- Improved logic for GPT disk UUID randomization to fix booting on Packet c3.medium.x86 machines ([flatcar-linux/bootengine#17](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/bootengine/pull/17))
- gpg: add patches for accepting keys without UIDs ([flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay#381](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/381))
- The static IP address configuration in the initramfs works again in the format `ip=::::::none[:[:]]` ([flatcar-linux/bootengine#15](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/bootengine/pull/15))


Changes:
- Since [version 245](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/blob/v245-stable/NEWS#L267) systemd-networkd ignores network unit files with an empty `[Match]` section. Add a `Name=*` entry to match all interfaces.
- Weave network interfaces are excluded from systemd-networkd ([flatcar-linux/init#22](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/init/pull/22))
- Enabled the mmio and vsock virtio kernel modules for Firecracker ([flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay#485](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/485))
- Enabled CONFIG_IKHEADERS to expose kernel headers under `/sys/kernel/kheaders.tar.xz`
- Vultr support in Ignition ([flatcar-linux/ignition#13](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/ignition/pull/13))
- VMware OVF settings default to ESXi 6.5 and Linux 3.x


Updates:
- Linux [5.4.55](https://lwn.net/Articles/827718/)
- systemd [v245](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/blob/v245-stable/NEWS)
- Docker [19.03.12](https://docs.docker.com/engine/release-notes/#190312)
- gnupg [2.2.20](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gnupg-announce/2020q1/000444.html)
- cryptsetup [2.0.3](https://www.saout.de/pipermail/dm-crypt/2018-May/005876.html)
- etcd [3.3.22](https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/releases/tag/v3.3.22)
- etcdctl [3.3.22](https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/releases/tag/v3.3.22)
- Go [1.13.14](https://go.googlesource.com/go/+/refs/tags/go1.13.14)
- Rust [1.44.1](https://blog.rust-lang.org/2020/06/18/Rust.1.44.1.html)

Note: Please note that ARM images remain experimental for now.

Security Fixes:

- Malicious URLs can cause Git to expose private credentials [CVE-2020-5260](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-5260)
- Similar to [CVE-2020-5260](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-5260), Malicious URLs can cause Git to expose private credentials [CVE-2020-11008](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-11008)

Bugfixes:
- Include dig binary in ARM [flatcar-linux/Flatcar#123](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/Flatcar/issues/123)
- Fix the login prompt issue in the ISO [flatcar-linux/Flatcar#131](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/Flatcar/issues/131)
- app-admin/{kubelet, etcd, flannel}-wrapper: don't overwrite the user supplied --insecure-options argument https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/426

## Flatcar updates

Security fixes:
- Fix e2fsprogs arbitrary code execution via crafted filesystem ([CVE-2019-5094](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-5094))
- Fix libarchive crash or use-after-free via crafted RAR file ([CVE-2019-18408](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-18408), [CVE-2020-9308](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-9308))
- Fix libgcrypt ECDSA timing attack ([CVE-2019-13627](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-13627))
- Fix libidn2 domain impersonation ([CVE-2019-12290](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-12290))
- Fix NSS crashes and heap corruption ([CVE-2017-11695](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11695), [CVE-2017-11696](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11696), [CVE-2017-11697](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11697), [CVE-2017-11698](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11698), [CVE-2018-18508](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-18508), [CVE-2019-11745](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-11745))
- Fix OpenSSL overflow in Montgomery squaring procedure ([CVE-2019-1551](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-1551))
- Fix SQLite crash and heap corruption ([CVE-2019-16168](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-16168), [CVE-2019-5827](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-5827))
- Fix unzip heap overflow or excessive resource consumption via crafted archive ([CVE-2018-1000035](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000035), [CVE-2019-13232](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-13232))
- Fix vim arbitrary command execution via crafted file ([CVE-2019-12735](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-12735))

Bug fixes:
- Revert adding the SELinux use flag for docker-runc until a regression is solved
- When writing the update kernel, prefer `/boot/coreos` only if `/boot/coreos/vmlinux-*` exists (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/update_engine/pull/5)
- Fixed sysroot-boot initramfs service race which resulted in a warning that this service failed

Changes:
- Support the CoreOS GRUB `/boot/coreos/first_boot` flag file (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/bootengine/pull/13)
- Fetch container images in docker format rather than ACI by default in `etcd-member.service`, `flanneld.service`, and `kubelet-wrapper`
- Add wireguard kernel module from [wireguard-linux-compat](https://git.zx2c4.com/wireguard-linux-compat)
- Include `wg` (wireguard-tools)
- Enable regex support for `jq`
- Use `flatcar.autologin` kernel command line parameter on Azure for auto login on the serial console

Updates:
- e2fsprogs [1.45.5](http://e2fsprogs.sourceforge.net/e2fsprogs-release.html#1.45.5)
- etcd [3.3.20](https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/releases/tag/v3.3.20)
- etcdctl [3.3.20](https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/releases/tag/v3.3.20)
- Linux [5.4.41](https://lwn.net/Articles/820524/)
- OpenSSL [1.0.2u](https://www.openssl.org/news/openssl-1.0.2-notes.html)
- vim [8.2.0360](http://ftp.vim.org/pub/vim/patches/8.2/README)
- systemd [243](https://github.com/systemd/systemd-stable/blob/v243-stable/NEWS)

Packages:
- docker 19.03.8
- ignition 0.34.0
- kernel 5.4.41
- rkt 1.30.0
- systemd 243

Architectures:
- amd64
- arm64

## Flatcar updates

Bug fixes:

- Support both guestinfo.ignition.config and guestinfo.coreos.config in coreos-cloudinit (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-cloudinit/pull/4)
- Fix VMware guestinfo variable retrieval and add missing variables in ignition (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/ignition/pull/11)
- Use flatcar.autologin for the console in oem-vmware (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/308)
- Log list of coredumps with coredumpctl in mayday (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/mayday/pull/8)

Updates:

- Linux [5.4.35](https://lwn.net/Articles/818569/)
- Go [1.13.10](https://go.googlesource.com/go/+/refs/tags/go1.13.10)
- containerd [1.3.4](https://github.com/containerd/containerd/releases/tag/v1.3.4)
- conntrack-tools [1.4.5](https://git.netfilter.org/conntrack-tools/tag/?h=conntrack-tools-1.4.5)
- linux-firmware [20191022](https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/firmware/linux-firmware.git/tag/?h=20191022)

- systemd 241

- amd64
- arm64

## Flatcar updates

Bug fixes:

- Use newest network interface naming scheme (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/Flatcar/issues/36)
- It is a possible breaking change for some persistent network interface names
- Fix coreos-cloudinit variable names (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/206)
- Prefer /boot/coreos to write updates (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/update_engine/pull/2)
- Build a download URL in a safer way (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/update_engine/issues/3)
- Remove /boot/coreos/first_boot after a Ignition rerun on migration (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/bootengine/pull/10)
- Support coreos.config.url as kernel command line parameter for Ignition (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/ignition/pull/10)
- Make flannel cross-node traffic work with systemd > 242 (https://github.com/coreos/flannel/issues/1155, https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/279)

Changes:

- Add `tracepath` alongside `traceroute6` (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/Flatcar/issues/50)
- Extend logging capabilities of mayday (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/Flatcar/issues/61)

Updates:

- Linux [4.19.113](https://lwn.net/Articles/815960/)
- Docker [19.03.8](https://github.com/docker/docker-ce/releases/tag/v19.03.8)
- open-vm-tools [11.0.5](https://github.com/vmware/open-vm-tools/releases/tag/stable-11.0.5)
- openssh [8.1](https://www.openssh.com/txt/release-8.1)
- WAAgent [2.2.46](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent/releases/tag/v2.2.46)

- kernel 4.19.113

## Flatcar updates

Bug fixes:

- Enable persistent network interface names already in the initramfs to fix https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/1767
- Do not error out in runc if SELinux is disabled on the system (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/189)
- Bring back runc 1.0-rc2 for Docker 17.03 (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/191)
- Use correct branch name format in developer container tools (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/dev-util/pull/2)

## Flatcar updates

Security fixes:

- Fix stack-based buffer overflow in sudo ([CVE-2019-18634](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-18634))
- Fix incorrect access control leading to privileges escalation in runc ([CVE-2019-19921](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-19921))
- Fix systemd use-after-free upon receiving crafted D-Bus message from local unprivileged attacker ([CVE-2020-1712](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-1712))

Bug fixes:

- Fix DNS resolution for the GCE metadata server (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/160)
- Use correct URLs for flatcar-linux in emerge-gitclone and scripts (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/dev-util/pull/1) (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/scripts/pull/50)
- Fix a wrong profile reference in torcx (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/162)
- Create symlink for /run/metadata/coreos (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/166)
- Create symlink for flatcar-install (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/init/pull/14)
- Fix backwards compatibility issues for users to migrate from CoreOS Container Linux (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/Flatcar/issues/16 https://github.com/flatcar-linux/afterburn/pull/7 https://github.com/flatcar-linux/bootengine/pull/7 https://github.com/flatcar-linux/bootengine/pull/8 https://github.com/flatcar-linux/init/pull/16 https://github.com/flatcar-linux/init/pull/17 https://github.com/flatcar-linux/ignition/pull/8)

Changes:

- Build Flatcar tarballs to be used by containers (https://github.com/flatcar-linux/scripts/pull/51)
- Enable qede kernel module

Updates:

- Linux [4.19.102](https://lwn.net/Articles/811638/)
- runc [1.0.0-rc10](https://github.com/opencontainers/runc/releases/tag/v1.0.0-rc10)
- sudo [1.8.31](https://www.sudo.ws/stable.html#1.8.31)

## Flatcar updates

Security fixes:

- Fix Intel CPU disclosure of memory to user process. Complete mitigation requires [manually disabling TSX or SMT](https://docs.flatcar-linux.org/os/disabling-smt/) on affected processors. ([CVE-2019-11135](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-11135), [TAA](https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/advisory/intel-sa-00270.html))
- Fix Intel CPU denial of service by a malicious guest VM ([CVE-2018-12207](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-12207))
- Fix curl Kerberos FTP double free ([CVE-2019-5481](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-5481))
- Fix curl TFTP buffer overflow with non-default block size ([CVE-2019-5482](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-5482))
- Fix OpenSSL key extraction attacks under non-default conditions ([CVE-2019-1563](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-1563), [CVE-2019-1547](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-1547))
- Fix panic caused by invalid DSA public keys in Go 1.12 and 1.13 ([CVE-2019-17596](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-17596))

Bug fixes:

- Fix CFS scheduler throttling highly-threaded I/O-bound applications ([#2623](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2623))
- Fix time zone for Brazil ([#2627](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2627))

Updates:

- Go [1.12.12](https://go.googlesource.com/go/+/refs/tags/go1.12.12) and [1.13.3](https://go.googlesource.com/go/+/refs/tags/go1.13.3)

## [Upstream Container Linux updates](https://github.com/coreos/manifest/releases/tag/v2093.0.0):

Security fixes:
- Fix OpenSSH `scp` allowing remote servers to change target directory permissions ([CVE-2018-20685](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20685))
- Fix OpenSSH outputting ANSI control codes from remote servers ([CVE-2019-6109](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-6109), [CVE-2019-6110](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-6110))
- Fix OpenSSH `scp` allowing remote servers to overwrite arbitrary files ([CVE-2019-6111](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-6111))
- Fix OpenSSL side-channel timing attack ([CVE-2018-5407](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5407))

- Fix curl buffer overflows ([CVE-2018-1000300](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000300), [CVE-2018-1000301](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000301))
- Fix Linux random seed during early boot ([CVE-2018-1108](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1108))

Changes:
- Reads of `/dev/urandom` early in boot will block until entropy pool is fully initialized
- Support friendly AWS EBS NVMe device names ([#2399](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2399))

Updates:
- cryptsetup [1.7.5](https://mirrors.edge.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/cryptsetup/v1.7/v1.7.5-ReleaseNotes)
- curl [7.60.0](https://curl.haxx.se/changes.html#7_60_0)

- etcdctl [3.3.8](https://github.com/coreos/etcd/releases/tag/v3.3.8)

- Locksmith [0.6.2](https://github.com/coreos/locksmith/releases/tag/v0.6.2)
- OpenSSL [1.0.2o](https://www.openssl.org/news/openssl-1.0.2-notes.html)

## [Upstream Container Linux updates](https://github.com/coreos/manifest/releases/tag/v1800.0.0):

Security fixes:
- Fix multiple procps vulnerabilities ([CVE-2018-1120](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1120), [CVE-2018-1121](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1121), [CVE-2018-1122](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1122), [CVE-2018-1123](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1123), [CVE-2018-1124](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1124), [CVE-2018-1125](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1125), [CVE-2018-1126](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1126), [CVE-2018-1120](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1120), [CVE-2018-1121](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1121), [CVE-2018-1122](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1122), [CVE-2018-1123](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1123), [CVE-2018-1124](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1124), [CVE-2018-1126](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1126))
- Fix shadow privilege escalation ([CVE-2018-7169](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-7169))
- Fix samba man-in-the-middle attack ([CVE-2016-2119](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-2119))
- Fix Git arbitrary code execution when cloning untrusted repositories ([CVE-2018-11235](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-11235))

Bug fixes:
- Fix failure to set network interface MTU ([#2443](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2443))
- Fix inadvertent change of network interface names ([#2437](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2437))
- Fix Docker bind mounts from root filesystem ([#2440](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2440))

Changes:
- Update VMware virtual hardware version to 11 (ESXi > 6.0)

## [Upstream Container Linux updates](https://github.com/coreos/manifest/releases/tag/v1786.0.1):

Security fixes:

- Fix ncurses denial of service and arbitrary code execution ([CVE-2017-10684](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-10684), [CVE-2017-10685](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-10685), [CVE-2017-11112](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11112), [CVE-2017-11113](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11113), [CVE-2017-13728](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-13728), [CVE-2017-13729](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-13729), [CVE-2017-13730](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-13730), [CVE-2017-13731](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-13731), [CVE-2017-13732](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-13732), [CVE-2017-13733](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-13733), [CVE-2017-13734](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-13734), [CVE-2017-16879](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-16879))
- Fix rsync arbitrary command execution ([CVE-2018-5764](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5764))
- Fix wget cookie injection ([CVE-2018-0494](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-0494))

Changes:
- Enable QLogic FCoE offload support ([#2367](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2367))
- Enable hardware RNG kernel drivers ([#2430](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2430))
- Add `notrap` to ntpd default access restrictions ([#2220](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2220))
- Allow booting default GRUB menu entry if GRUB password is enabled ([#1597](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/1597))
- `coreos-install -i` no longer modifies `grub.cfg` ([#2291](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2291))
- QEMU wrapper script now enables VirtIO RNG device

## [Upstream Container Linux updates](https://github.com/coreos/manifest/releases/tag/v1758.0.0):

Security fixes:
- Fix ntp clock manipulation from ephemeral connections ([CVE-2016-1549](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-1549), [CVE-2018-7170](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-7170))
- Fix ntp denial of service from out of bounds read ([CVE-2018-7182](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-7182))
- Fix ntp denial of service from packets with timestamp 0 ([CVE-2018-7184](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-7184), [CVE-2018-7185](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-7185))
- Fix ntp remote code execution ([CVE-2018-7183](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-7183))

Bug fixes:
- Pass `/etc/machine-id` from the host to the kubelet
- Fix docker2aci tar conversion ([#2402](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2402))
- Switch `/boot` from FAT16 to FAT32 ([#2246](https://github.com/coreos/bugs/issues/2246))

Changes:
- Make Ignition failures more visible on the console

Updates:
- containerd [1.0.3](https://github.com/containerd/containerd/releases/tag/v1.0.3)
- coreos-cloudinit [1.14.0](https://github.com/coreos/coreos-cloudinit/releases/tag/v1.14.0)

- Go [1.9.5](https://golang.org/doc/devel/release.html#go1.9.minor)
- Go [1.10.1](https://golang.org/doc/devel/release.html#go1.10.minor)
- Linux [4.16.3](https://lwn.net/ml/linux-kernel/20180419074956.GA22325@kroah.com/)

## Flatcar updates

Initial Flatcar release.

Notes:
- Previous test images have been removed from the release servers. This is due to a new update key being generated using our updated security policy which we [included](https://github.com/flatcar-linux/coreos-overlay/pull/6) in the first public image.

## [Upstream Container Linux updates](https://github.com/coreos/manifest/releases/tag/v1745.0.0):

Security fixes:
- Fix curl out of bounds read ([CVE-2018-1000005](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000005))
